supoose, we have a gui, developed in netbeans platform ... in this 
we can draw some process diagram using some icons like start, 
stop, decision box, activity and after that we can develop some 
xml from that gui ... now my aim is to test that gui...
how can i do that?


On Tue, 11 Jun 2002 Bob Koss wrote :
>On 6/11/02 2:44 AM, "sudipto  chattopadhyay" 
><c_sudipto2002@...>
>wrote:
>
> > is there any way to test gui components using junit. if 
>possible
> > then how can i do? anyone can suggest about this?
> > Sudipto
>
>Sure. But first you have to decide which aspect(s) of the gui you 
>want to
>test. For many people, making the gui so stupid that it can't 
>possibly break
>and having it delegate to a class that can be unit tested, is 
>sufficient.
>
>
